intro: Trachelium jacquinii, commonly known as the purple trachelium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Trachelium jacquinii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
